      If the surroundings of the token are important, the token itself can be indicated via a group in the regex.

      • getTokenRegexFilter

        TokenRegexFilter getTokenRegexFilter(String regex,
                                   int groupIndex,
                                   String replacement)
        Get a token filter that applies a regex to a given text, and marks an matches found as tokens.
        In addition, if a replacement is provided, the text of the token will be set to the value of the replacement.
        If the surroundings of the token are important, the token itself can be indicated via a group in the regex.
        Parameters:
        regex - the regex to look for
        groupIndex - the group index within the regex corresponding to the token being searched for
        replacement - the text to be assigned to this token - can refer to groups in the regex via standard $1, $2 usage
        Returns:

      • getTokenSequenceFilter

        TokenSequenceFilter getTokenSequenceFilter(String descriptor)
        Gets a TokenSequenceFilter corresponding to a given descriptor. The descriptor should contain the class name, followed by any arguments, separated by tabs.
        Parameters:
        descriptor -
        Returns:

                                 List<String> descriptors)

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • getTokenSequenceFilter

        TokenSequenceFilter getTokenSequenceFilter(List<TokenFilter> tokenFilters)
        Get a TokenSequenceFilter that wraps a list of token filters. While it won't re-assign any token boundaries, it will check each TokenFilter against each individual token, and if a match is found, will replace the text.
        Parameters:
        tokenFilter -
        Returns:
